You tell them to get lost. lol

Soybean farmers do have to suffer a short-term economic loss, should this so-called "punishment" fall on their shoulders. I personally don't foresee it being a long-term struggle, as farmers will seek to plant different types of crops. Plus, it's quite redundant for ccp to threaten them with a reduction of trade activities. Their virus has done enough damages to everyone and ruined all the relationships they built with the world over time, no need to beat a dead horse.
